meanings.definition: The outer limits or edge of an area or object.
meanings.sent1: She stood at the periphery of the playground, watching the other children play.
meanings.sent2: The periphery of the forest is home to many different types of wildlife.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel danced around the periphery of the tree, teasing the cat below.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts lingered at the periphery of his mind, waiting to be acknowledged.
meanings.sent5: The periphery of the city was dotted with small villages, each with its own charm.

meanings.definition: The area surrounding a particular place or thing.
meanings.sent1: The periphery of the park was filled with colorful flowers and trees.
meanings.sent2: She scanned the periphery of the room, looking for familiar faces.
meanings.sent3: The cat prowled around the periphery of the garden, searching for mice.
meanings.sent4: His jokes always stayed on the periphery of good taste, never crossing the line.
meanings.sent5: The periphery of the lake shimmered in the sunlight, creating a beautiful reflection.
